text: Its difficult to believe this thing really exists, but it does, or at least it did. It was boozy as hell, sweet, extremely floral. Nice color? I dunno how anyone drinks Malt Liquor though.
Draft at the Cafe with Linh and Ken. Pours a bright, hazy pink body with thick pink lacing. Nose is strong hibiscus florals. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of grains, alcohol and hibiscus.
Draft. Pink pour with white head. Floral, sweet honey, yeast aromas. Flavors are malty, boozy, honey and floral notes.

Lightly hazy orange-purple-red body, thin off-white head, sparse lacing. Some mixed berries, booze, stonefruits, hibiscus flowers, more booze, light biscuit. Medium bodied, moderately sweet and boozy. Good for what it is.
Draft, pours hazy pink brown with small to medium head. Notes of Cherry chalk, hibiscus, Apple skin, and brandy. Light to medium body. Not bad but not sure about the style.
Draft - pours orange white head - nose and taste of honey, caramel, hibiscus, peach alcohol - med body

Draft at TH brew cafe. Pours a opaque rhubarb brownish red with foam that lingers slightly for a TH beer. Aroma is nooze, cinnamon and honey. First sip is similar with a warm sweet finish like a cognac. Surprisingly good.
Pours a hazy deep purple with a light pink head. Aroma of berries and booze. Taste follows with a medicinal note. Quite boozy but thats expected for the style.
Draft at Cafe. Pours a reddish purple with a small cream/light purple head. Aroma of honey, malt and flowers. Taste of honey, malt and hibiscus flowers.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2016 Draft at TH. 1ST rating of this. Another unusual, creative release from this awesome crew. High ABV is well hidden. Red pour and a mild fruity lager aroma. Called a malt liquor but I dont see it. American strong ale is more accurate. Some cherry, prune, dash of lemon, mild hop bitterness in finish. Deceptive, interesting.
